value.name: Fighting talk from Reading Tories after Labour leader visit
value.description: The local Conservative leader has accused Labour party leader Sir Keir Starmer of painting Reading ‘in the worst possible light’ in a

value.name: Councillors lose bid to stop plans for three-weekly bin collections in Cardiff
value.description: Councillors' attempts to overturn controversial plans for one black bin bag collection every three weeks failed. Conservative councillors at Cardiff Council, led by Cllr John Lancaster, put forward a motion calling for a re-think on waste collection proposals at a full council meeting on Thursday, January 25.

value.name: Britain's 'most capable PM'? Starmer opens up record 13-point lead over Sunak in new Ipsos poll
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer has opened up a record 13-point lead over Rishi Sunak in terms of who Britons think is the “most capable Prime Minister ”, according to a new poll.

value.name: Ross attacks SNP over ‘orchestrated and concerted’ deletion of Covid WhatsApps
value.description: Douglas Ross, the leader of the Scottish Conservatives, said those who lost loved ones to coronavirus had been “betrayed”, as he accused the Scottish Government of taking “secrecy and cover-up to a new low”. Ross challenged the SNP over the issue following evidence to the UK Covid-19 Inquiry from some of the key figures during the pandemic.

value.name: Rishi Sunak has much to be proud of. He might yet sneak a win
value.description: WHEREVER Rishi Sunak looks, the received wisdom is that he, the Conservatives and their General Election campaign are all doomed. But in years

value.name: SNP and Tories accuse each other of politicising pandemic
value.description: The SNP and Scottish Conservatives have accused each other of politicising the pandemic after evidence at the UK Covid inquiry showed ministers

value.name: 70% of housebuilders want Labour to win General Election, says Knight Frank
value.description: The Knight Frank Land Index & Housebuilder Survey of English housebuilders shows 70% favour Labour government plans for reform.

value.name: Frontrunner to replace Mark Drakeford sparks fury over EU single market demand
